snippet: Public schools for the first time are offering classes in Islam to primary school students to better integrate Germany’s large Muslim minority and to try to counter the influence of radical religious thinking.
abstract: German public schools for the first time are offering classes in Islam to primary school students to better integrate nation’s large Muslim minority and to try to counter the influence of radical religious thinking; classes are part of growing consensus that Germany, after decades of neglect, should do more to acknowledge and serve its Muslim population if it is to foster social harmony, overcome its aging demographics and head off a potential domestic security threat.
lead_paragraph: Public schools for the first time are offering classes in Islam to primary school students to better integrate Germany’s large Muslim minority and to try to counter the influence of radical religious thinking.

headline.main: Germany Adds Lessons in Islam to Better Blend Its Melting Pot
headline.print_headline: To Better Blend Its Melting Pot, Germany Adds Lessons in Islam
